The Blue Devils bounced back at home on Tuesday against a tough Centennial golf team.

The Blue Devils won their varsity match 182-187 and the junior varsity pulled out a win as well 214-217.

Way to go Blue Devils and congrats on your first win of the season.

Junior Varsity highlights. Sophomore Leighton Meeker-52, Junior Noah Pitzer-52, Senior Isaac Tabels-53, and Freshman Jordan Johnson-57.

The Blue Devil Golf team returns to action this coming Friday, August 28th at home against Danville High School.

Please welcome Miss Lindsey Andrews to BHRA. She will be student teaching under Ms. Watson this fall.

My name is Lindsey Andrews and I will be completing my student teaching with Miss Watson this fall in English 3 & 4. I graduated from Bismarck-Henning in 2016 and I am so excited to be back! There is no other place I would rather complete my internship than home.

While I was a student at Bismarck, I participated in volleyball, basketball, softball, NHS, and student council. After graduating high school, I continued my education and softball career at Kankakee Community College and The University of St. Francis. The last two years I have lived in Joliet, but this spring I moved back to Bismarck with my family.

Once I complete my student teaching this fall, I will graduate from USF with my Bachelor‚Äôs in Secondary English Education. I am so excited to be home and begin the school year!
